name: politico
text:
Trump accused Drudge of spreading rumors that the president had gone to Walter Reed Medical Center last year over “mini-strokes.”

“Drudge didn’t support me in 2016, and I hear he doesn’t support me now,” he tweeted. “Maybe that’s why he is doing poorly.” https://t.co/5EY9bKfqJd

name: politico
text:
Trump's campaign also called for CNN to fire Joe Lockhart, saying he had spread the story.

Lockhart tweeted last night wondering whether Trump had had “a stroke which he is hiding from the American public,” but denied reporting any kind of stroke as fact. https://t.co/5EY9bKfqJd

name: politico
text: Facebook has taken down a network of fake accounts that appeared to target progressives. The accounts were tied to the troll farm accused of mounting an anti-Hillary Clinton propaganda effort in 2016 and also recruited freelancers to write news stories https://t.co/FqUPLJ6FII

name: politico
text:
Mexico has been hit hard by the pandemic – and Covid-19 has preyed on their factory workers. In those communities, “if you don't die from the virus, you will die from poverty,” journalist @gaminjares told our reporter @renurayasam at the border.

https://t.co/lWU6ZFcA3j https://t.co/mIWh6fvbL2

name: politico
text: The Department of Homeland Security's cybersecurity arm and the FBI said they've seen no cyberattacks on voter registration databases this year https://t.co/ZxWA43PZtU

name: politico
text:
Mexico has recorded nearly 600K virus cases and nearly 65K deaths, though most agree that the official stats are missing a huge number of cases and deaths because of a lack of testing and record keeping.

More in our nightly coronavirus newsletter:  https://t.co/TzxUNVXgLv
